subclusters.subcluster_name: Replicative and Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
Genetic Regulation of Cellular Senescence Theory
Pharmacological and Therapeutic Modulation of Cellular Senescence Theory
Circadian and Hypoxia-Regulated Cellular Senescence Theory
DNA Damage and Inflammation-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on replicative senescence via telomere shortening and stress-induced premature senescence pathways mediated by tumor suppressors like p53 and p16.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes telomere shortening as a molecular clock triggering replicative senescence and genetic control of senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes both telomere-dependent and telomere-independent senescence pathways, highlighting replicative and stress-induced mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses replicative senescence driven by telomere shortening and broader senescence responses to DNA damage and oncogene activation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details replicative senescence via p53-p21-pRB and stress-induced senescence via p16-pRB pathways, combining both mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on replicative senescence as a mitotic clock driven by telomere shortening and its role in organismal aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on replicative senescence in hematopoietic cells driven by telomere shortening and limited telomerase activity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes replicative senescence as exhaustion of proliferative capacity regulated by molecular pathways, studied via viral oncogenes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Regulation of Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on genetic programming of senescence, dominance of senescence phenotype, and specific genes/chromosomes controlling senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Regulation of Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes genetic and molecular basis of senescence, including cell cycle gene regulation and genetic control of cellular lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Regulation of Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights the INK4a/ARF locus as a genetic regulator linking senescence and aging via tumor suppressor pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Pharmacological and Therapeutic Modulation of Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on pharmacological interventions (senolytics, senomorphics) targeting senescent cells to mitigate aging effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Pharmacological and Therapeutic Modulation of Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senolytic therapy to eliminate senescent endothelial cells and rejuvenate tissue function.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Pharmacological and Therapeutic Modulation of Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses therapeutic targeting of senescent vascular cells to mitigate vascular aging and disease.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Pharmacological and Therapeutic Modulation of Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mTORC1 signaling inhibition as a targeted approach to suppress senescence and delay aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Reprogramming and Cellular Senescence Reversal Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes epigenetic clock resetting and rejuvenation of senescent cells via iPSC reprogramming and mitochondrial restoration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Circadian and Hypoxia-Regulated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on circadian rhythm proteins (BMAL1), hypoxia (HIF-1α), and their interaction regulating cellular senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Circadian and Hypoxia-Regulated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights sex-dependent differences in senescence signaling and cell cycle regulation affecting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence in Cellular Plasticity and Regeneration Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explores dual roles of senescence in aging and regeneration, influencing cellular plasticity and tissue remodeling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes progressive senescence in chondrocytes involving telomere shortening and stress, with potential reversibility.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage and Inflammation-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on chronic inflammation causing DNA damage, DDR activation, and SASP driving senescence and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage and Inflammation-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes ROS-induced DNA damage, impaired repair, and cGAS-STING-mediated inflammation triggering senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage and Inflammation-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes SASP-mediated inflammation and dual beneficial/harmful roles of senescent cells in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage and Inflammation-Driven Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details multiple senescence triggers including DNA damage and oxidative stress, SASP, and tumor suppression roles.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on telomerase loss, telomere dynamics, and replicative senescence mechanisms studied in yeast model.
